intro: Ceropegia distincta subsp. lugardiae, commonly known as the Cape Kruger ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish, with a distinctive corona that attracts specific pollinators. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
